Posts.Content: Hi all I was diagnosed with bc in Sept - l 've had a lumpectomy and radiotherapy and will have 4 more sessions of Zemeta infusion over the next 2 years. I am gradually improving my physical and mental stamina but as l have other health issues this l suspect will be a slow process. When l was diagnosed l had lots of offers of support - some turned out to be genuine. But since l completed my radiothetapy l get the feeling some of my family and friends are getting abit "bored" of my illness. I don't feel l over emphasis the struggles l have and l try to present a positive face. I only discuss bc when asked. But l still need support as does my husband and l feel like "yesterday' news" with some long standing "friends" - has anyone else found this ?

Posts.Content: I got "R 1 " and "R 2" gel and creams from my GP. Specific treatment for radiotherapy treatments. I would definitely recommend them. I on the large side so more at risk of problems and l had one small sore area. My BC nurse said she was v impressed. Take care K x

Posts.Content: Hi all. First annual check up post lumpectomy. I had a mamagram and saw consultant who said "as far as she could see it was all clear(?) But the results had to go to a radiologist to be checked and ld hear in a couple of weeks". Has anyone else had this response? Left me feeling anxious again.Also she said l had lymphodema of the breast and gave me some massage techniques to do - just line drawings. Some involve having a helper and they need to be done 3 x daily? Any experience of this technique would be appreciated.
